h4.span: Distance Learning Resources, Official District Updates and Other Important Information during the Covid-19 Pandemic.

p.span: Please visit the tabs below for all official Pasadena ISD announcements and other important information. Information will include any district procedural changes, important contacts and any other helpful information as we maneuver through the pandemic.

span.em: The Tabs below (HTML5) are not supported in Internet Explorer when Compatibility Mode is used. If you are having trouble using Internet Explorer please switch to Chrome or a different browser to access the district website.

                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl26_divTabs_0","title":"COVID-19 PARENT SURVEY  ENCUESTA DE PADRES DE COVID-19","content":"

Pasadena ISD - COVID-19 response parent survey

We want to know how we’re doing in serving your family’s educational needs during the coronavirus/COVID-19 pandemic.

Please take 10-15 minutes to provide us with important information we will use now and in the future to shape Pasadena ISD practices.

Please click the link to fill out your survey.

https://www.research.net/r/sp2020parent






Distrito Ecolar Integrado de Pasadena. Encuesta COVID-19

Queremos saber cómo estamos atendiendo las necesidades educativas de su familia durante la pandemia del coronavirus/COVID-19.

Por favor, tome 10 o 15 minutos de su tiempo para darnos información importante que usaremos ahora y en el futuro para dar forma a las prácticas del distrito escolar de Pasadena.

¡Gracias!

https://es.research.net/r/sp2020parent2","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl26_divTabs_1","title":"Dr. Powell Updates & Announcements","content":"
UPDATE 4/17/2020








As per Governor Abbott’s executive order, Pasadena ISD will remain closed to in-person instruction for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year through May 28, 2020.  Pasadena ISD students will continue instruction through our online platforms or instructional packets.  Also, all school-related student activities are canceled during this time. 



Curbside grab-and-go meal distribution will continue next week, Monday-Friday, same times and locations.  



Thank you for partnering with us as we continue distance learning.








UPDATE 4/9/2020





Pasadena ISD Family,



We have been away from our normal routines for almost a month now. I know this is probably as difficult for each of you as it is for my children and me. The pandemic we are facing is not only affecting the education of our children, but it has threatened our health, our emotional and financial well-being for many as well. If you need information on helping your child cope with the pandemic, you can find resources here: How do you support your child during a pandemic?



Other important updates:



Friday, April 10th is a student and staff holiday. I wish each of you a wonderful Easter holiday.  Monday, April 13th was previously a staff development day but because we are learning at home it will now be day of instruction.  I know your child’s teacher looks forward to working with them on Monday.



We are also excited to announce we received approval to serve curbside grab-and-go meals Monday, April 13th; therefore, we will serve meals every school day next week.  



We also hope you have seen our daily communication via social media regarding lessening the spread of the COVID-19 virus.  We have partnered with the Texas Education Agency on the “Stay Well, Texas” program to communicate the importance of social distancing and helping to flatten the curve. Help us get the word out by sharing our post daily titled “APART WE STAND TOGETHER.”



As part of our social distancing expectations we are asking you to refrain from using our school playgrounds, benches, and sports equipment. They are closed for public use to help prevent the spread of the COVID-19 virus. 



Next week, we will ask for your input in order to help guide our next steps as we continue with our distance learning. We are asking you to complete a survey next week about services and resources being provided by the district. Your responses will help us meet the needs of you and your children during this time. A link to the survey will be posted on Thursday, April 16th, on social media and our district website. We look forward to hearing from you!



And one last very important note is about the 2020 Census. If you have not completed your 2020 census, please do so because we want our community represented and counted!  You can complete the census through this site: https://my2020census.gov/.  Our public schools are funded based on the information provided in the 2020 Census so it is critically important that we are all counted. I encourage you to complete it today.



As always, if you have questions or concerns, please reach out to your child’s teacher, counselor or principal because we will get through this pandemic together.  



My thoughts and prayers are with each of you during this time.



Take care,

DeeAnn Powell








UPDATE 3/31/2020







UPDATE 3/27/2020





 



UPDATE 3/16/2020





 

All Pasadena ISD facilities will remain closed for normal operations through Friday, April 10, 2020, in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

The Houston area continues to see an increasing number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 and health officials report this number is expected to increase as more testing is made available.



The Centers for Disease Control has outlined the need for all communities to implement a social distancing protocol. The district anticipates beginning instructional support outside of school through the use of electronic and non-electronic materials on Monday, March 23, 2020. Right now we are working diligently to prepare our staff to be able to provide support and feedback to your students. Parents will receive further information regarding instruction from their child’s campus. Our website has optional extended learning opportunities and activities for students. We encourage parents and students to visit the district’s website and social media often for the most recent updates as we navigate this unprecedented situation together.  



The health of Pasadena ISD students, staff and community continues to be the District’s top priority.  Pasadena Independent School District will offer curbside grab-and-go free breakfast and lunch to all Pasadena ISD students beginning tomorrow. Parents may drive by any of our traditional High School campuses to pick up a meal for each child present in the vehicle. Breakfast will be served from 7:30-8:30 a.m., and lunch will be served from 11:00 a.m.-12:30 p.m.

Todas las instalaciones de Pasadena ISD permanecerán cerradas para operaciones normales hasta el viernes 10 de abril de 2020, en respuesta a la pandemia de COVID-19. El área de Houston continúa viendo un número creciente de casos confirmados de COVID-19 y los funcionarios de salud informan que se espera que este número aumente a medida que se realicen más pruebas.



Los Centros para el Control de Enfermedades han señalado la necesidad de que todas las comunidades implementen un protocolo de distanciamiento social. El distrito prevé comenzar el apoyo educativo fuera de la escuela mediante el uso de materiales electrónicos y no electrónicos el lunes 23 de marzo de 2020. En este momento estamos trabajando diligentemente para preparar a nuestro personal para poder brindar apoyo y comentarios a sus estudiantes. 



Los padres recibirán más información sobre la instrucción del campus de sus hijos. Nuestro sitio web tiene oportunidades y actividades de aprendizaje extendido opcionales para estudiantes. Alentamos a los padres y estudiantes a visitar el sitio web y las redes sociales del distrito a menudo para obtener las actualizaciones más recientes mientras navegamos juntos por esta situación sin precedentes.




Pasadena Independent School District will be closed next week, March 16-20, 2020, in an effort to help prevent the broader spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19).

Pasadena ISD has made this decision in collaboration with many other school districts in the greater Houston area.  All University Scholastic League (UIL) and other related school events scheduled for next week are also canceled.  The Superintendent will continue to work with state and local authorities to determine any future actions.




UPDATE 03/12/2020

We hope you are enjoying your Spring Break. We want to provide an update regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19). 

 

Pasadena ISD continues to monitor the Coronavirus outbreak and work with the Harris County Public Health and the Center for Disease Control. 

 

Many of you are asking about school on Monday, March 16, 2020.

 

As of today:

    
There are no confirmed cases of the Coronavirus in Pasadena ISD. We realize that can quickly change, which is why our Superintendent of Schools and Chief Nursing Officer are in daily conference calls with county and state health authorities.   
    
All Pasadena ISD facilities and school busses are being cleaned and disinfected in preparation for school on Monday.
    
A formal announcement regarding school, which will be based on the CDC recommendations, will be made Sunday afternoon.
    
A reminder: if students or staff traveled to a country on the CDC travel advisory list, they will likely be required to self-quarantine for 14 days.

With the return to school from spring break, many Pasadena ISD families and staff may have traveled outside and within the United States. Pasadena ISD has gathered the information below to help keep staff, students and their families safe during and after spring break.





Travel to affected countries

Depending on your destination, you should check with your airline to ensure that travel to that destination has not been affected. Currently, most major airlines have suspended travel to mainland China and others have reduced the number of flights to destinations such as Japan, Italy, and South Korea due to outbreaks of the Novel Coronavirus, or COVID-19.



The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has issued Level 3 travel health advisories for several countries—currently China, Iran, Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Monaco, San Marino, Vatican City and South Korea—which recommend avoiding nonessential travel. It has issued a Level 2 advisory for Japan, asking people to practice enhanced precautions if traveling there. Visit the travel notices page at CDC for updates.



Several airlines are waiving change fees for passengers changing their flights due to the outbreak. Check with your airline for details on changing or canceling your flight.

Returning to Pasadena

According to Harris County Health and Human Services, travelers arriving in the United States from Level 3 Travel Health Notice countries (listed above) will be asked to do the following:



Stay home for 14 days from the time you left an area with widespread, ongoing community spread of the virus and practice social distancing, practice social distancing and take these steps to monitor your health:



    
Take your temperature with a thermometer two times a day and monitor for fever. Also watch for cough or trouble breathing.

    
    
Stay home and avoid contact with others. Do not go to work or school for this 14-day period. Discuss your work situation with your employer/administrator before returning to work.

    
    
Do not take public transportation, taxis, or ride-shares during the time you are practicing social distancing.

    
    
Avoid crowded places (such as shopping centers and movie theaters) and limit your activities in public.

    
    
Keep your distance from others (about 6 feet or 2 meters).




If you get sick with fever (100.4°F/38°C or higher), cough, or have trouble breathing:



    
Seek medical care. Call ahead before you go to a doctor’s office or emergency room.

    
    
Tell your doctor about your recent travel and your symptoms.

    
    
Avoid contact with others.


For a quick reference about what to do if you feel you have symptoms, download this guide.



If you need to seek medical care for other reasons, such as dialysis, call ahead to your doctor and tell them about your recent travel to an area with widespread or ongoing community spread of COVID-19.





Travel within the United States

If traveling to areas within the United States that have reported cases of Coronavirus, exercise caution. If you feel symptoms similar to those described for Coronavirus during travel or upon returning to Pasadena, the general recommendation is to contact a medical professional and follow instructions.








UPDATE 03/05/2020

Pasadena ISD is closely monitoring the Coronavirus outbreak.  Despite the recent developments related to the coronavirus (COVID-19), the risk to our community remains extremely low.  We will continue to work with the Harris County Department of Health and the Center for Disease Control.  

Custodial staff is disinfecting all of our campuses daily.  Please help us to remind your child to wash their hands regularly.  School nurses are following exclusionary criteria for all communicable diseases, including reminding parents to keep sick children home.

The CDC has issued a level 3 travel advisory to highly infected regions including Italy, China, South Korea, and Iran.  Please let your school administration know if you have plans to travel to any of these areas over Spring Break.  As always we appreciate your help to keep Pasadena ISD students safe.




> Pasadena ISD Community Letter with Alert Status Descriptions

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl26_divTabs_2","title":"AP - Advanced Placement Testing","content":"
AP - ADVANCED PLACEMENT 

HELP YOUR STUDENT PREPARE FOR AP EXAMS with Trevor Packer

Live Parent Webinar April 16, 2020 at 6pm.

Trevor will be discussing this year's at-home AP exams and how to help your child prepare. 



> Follow this link to view webinar


 

All Advanced Placement (AP) tests will be taken from home for the 2019-2020 school year. If a student is in need of technology resources including a device or Wi-Fi access, please refer to the Pasadena Independent School District Distance Learning page for additional information.

What Students should know and do for AP testing:

    
Students need to check their College Board Account for updates. If any student has a problem that he or she cannot solve, please reach out to the current AP teacher for assistance.

    

    
    
AP exams have been revised to about 45 minutes and will be taken online, at home. · AP Exams are scheduled for May 11-22 with make-up testing on June 1-5. Here is a link to the dates.

    

    
    
This year’s exams focus on content most teachers covered prior to March. So this year’s exams have been designed to honor the good work students did prior to school closures.

    

    
    
Colleges across the country are voicing strong support for students to complete the AP experience, take the exam, and receive the college credit they deserve. Colleges are especially supportive given the uncertain financial future many families face, and the value of students entering college with credit.

    

    
    
Students who have registered for the exam and not paid should take the exam anyway. They may pay at a later date.


Preparing for the Exam:

    
Here is the link to Khan Academy for free practice for the AP Tests: https://www.khanacademy.org/resources/students

    

    
    
College Board has YouTube has daily instruction for AP students: 

    Here is the link: https://www.youtube.com/user/advancedplacement?excmpid=SM51-PR-1-tw

    

    
    
Online AP Course schedule and additional information about the test is located here: https://apcoronavirusupdates.collegeboard.org/students/ap-course-schedule


 ","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl26_divTabs_3","title":"College Readiness Resources for Spring 2020","content":"
College Readiness Resources for Spring 2020

COLLEGE APPLICATIONS

Many institutions are continuing to accept applications for summer and fall 2020.  Contact your CollegeNow Coordinator or the college/university for assistance.  



Apply to schools in Texas at www.applytexas.org



DUAL CREDIT ENROLLMENT for SUMMER and FALL COURSES

You may continue with the enrollment process at this time.  

Contact your College Now Coordinator for more information.  



ADMISSIONS TESTING

TSIA:  At this time, all TSIA testing is on hold until further notice.  

SAT/ACT:  At this time, all SAT and ACT sessions have been cancelled until June. The ACT will have test administration in June and July. 

You can sign up using http://www.act.org/

The SAT will have administrations in June and August. You can sign up using www.sat.org. You are HIGHLY encouraged to sign up for one or both of these tests. If you are on free or reduced lunch, email your College Now Coordinator and they will send you a fee waiver code. Please include your name and ID.

Studying for SAT/ACT:  Use this extra time to put in some extra practice for the ACT at https://academy.act.org/ 

Practice for SAT at https://www.khanacademy.org/



FINANCIAL AID 

There is still time to complete FAFSA (Free Application for Federal Student Aid) 

Create an FSA ID- https://fsaid.ed.gov/npas/index.htm

Complete a FAFSA- https://studentaid.gov/h/apply-for-aid/fafsa

FAFSA help:  https://studentaidhelp.ed.gov   Live Chat 1-800-433-3243

www.projectgradhouston.org



SCHOLARSHIPS 

Contact the scholarship organizations directly to find out if there are any changes to scholarship deadlines.  You may also contact your College Now Coordinator or check your school College Now website for any updates.



OPPORTUNITY SCHOLARSHIP

Juniors don’t forget to keep working on the opportunity scholarship. You can earn money by doing what you are already doing. https://opportunity.collegeboard.org/



REQUESTING TRANSCRIPTS 

You will be able to request your final transcript to be sent to your choice of college or university.  If the transcript is needed for a scholarship, contact your College Now Coordinator.  



HARRIS COUNTY PROMISE 

The next deadline for FAFSA/TASFA completion has been extended to May 4th. The deadline for enrollment is still July 15th.  See the Harris County Promise or San Jacinto College websites for more information. 

www.harriscountypromise.org or 

https://www.sanjac.edu/admissions-aid/paying-college/harris-county-promise-program

VIRTUAL COLLEGE ADVISING

ADVi is a new virtual tool to support college advising from the Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board.  ADVi is a chatbot – free to use (data and message rates may apply based on the user's mobile phone plan) – that can answer college questions via a text message or web chat 24 hours a day, seven days a week.  Check it out on askadvi.org.



Texas Association for College Admission Counseling:

Though our NACAC and TACAC College Fairs were cancelled,

your students now have an opportunity to attend a virtual college fair

with hundreds of colleges represented!

    
STRIVE FOR COLLEGE KNOWLEDGE

    Virtual College Exploration Week

    April 20-23, 2020

    Four full days of virtual presentations for juniors to explore college opportunities

    Free of charge for students and colleges


The fair schedule can be found here





Seniors planning to attend San Jacinto College:

Request an Advising appointment from San Jacinto College

Go to this link- http://appointments.sjcd.edu/

    
Select Campus: (you can choose South or Central, either can help you)
    
Select Department
    
Select Reason for Visit 
    
Select Advisor- you can select anyone (then click the yellow “select” button on right)
    
Select and date/time (then click the yellow “select” button on right)
    
Fill in your personal info, San Jac G#, and your contact info (make sure you type it correctly!) 
    
Select: Book Appointment



There will be drop boxes on campus for any FAFSA/TASFA IRS forms to be submitted.



University/College Updates: Check your future university/college website for their most updated information.



Application Fee Waivers:  Many colleges/universities are still accepting waivers but may request both student and counselor/CNC signature and will be submitted electronically.  Contact your College Now Coordinator for more information..  



Check your email daily for updates and information. 



If you have additional questions please contact your College Now Coordinator:

Pasadena High School - rrivera@pasadenaisd.org 

Sam Rayburn High School - scarnes@pasadenaisd.org 

South Houston High School - cjames@pasadenaisd.org 

Dobie High School - jejohnson@pasadenaisd.org	

Pasadena Memorial High School - tlevans@pasadenaisd.org 

Tegeler Career Center - ghobsonjr@pasadenaisd.org 

Lewis Career and Technical High School - tgernander@pasadenaisd.org ","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl26_divTabs_4","title":"Parents & Students: Distance Learning Resources","content":"
Please visit the Pasadena ISD Distance Learning site for information and links to online resources for both parents and students.



As we begin our journey into Distance Learning, please check for communication directly from your student's campus on specific instructions regarding coursework, assignments and access to Distance Learning resources. 










Enjoy some Virtual Field Trips while still maintaining the required social distancing. 

    
Houston Zoo

    Zookeepers hop in front of the camera and give daily updates of what the animals are up to while the zoo is shut down.

    Visit the Houston Zoo website or one of their social media pages for more info

    

    
    
San Diego Zoo

    The San Diego Zoo has a special kids section filled with videos, activities and games.  Visit the San Diego Zoo website

    

    
    
Yellowstone National Park

    You don’t have to wait for a trip out to Yellowstone to check out Mud Volcano, Mammoth Hot Springs, or Fort Yellowstone. You can take a virtual tour here.

    

    
    
Mars

    Ever wanted to see Mars? Now you can explore the surface of Mars on the Curiosity Rover through a 360 digital view.

    

    
    
Zoos & Aquariums

    You can explore the San Diego Zoo, Monterey Bay Aquarium, the Panda Cam at Zoo Atlanta, animal cams at Houston Zoo, and the Georgia Aquarium.

    

    
    
Virtual Farm Tour

    Farm Food 360 offers 11 virtual tours from apple orchards to pig farms.

    

    
    
U.S. Space and Rocket Museum

    Take a trip to Huntsville, AL and see the Saturn 5 Rocket and the U.S. Space and Rocket Museum in this YouTube video tour.

    

    
    
Discovery Education Virtual Field Trips

    Discovery Education offers a number of virtual field trips, like exploring the Tundra and polar bears, learning about robotics and manufacturing, or blast off to the Johnson Space Center.

    

    
    
The Louvre

    Take a trip to Paris, France and see all The Louvre has to offer.

    

    
    
The Great Wall of China

    Head to the Great Wall of China and take a tour of China’s most famous attraction.

    

    
    
Boston Children’s Museum

    Take a virtual tour through Google Maps of the Boston Children’s Museum and explore all 3 floors!





","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl26_divTabs_5","title":"Technology Support: Student Device & Login Issues, Home Internet Access","content":"
Student Device Tech Support



Please note that we have updated our support location, dates, and hours.  Support at the Carmen Orozco Professional Development Complex, at 1832 E Sam Houston Parkway S, will be available 10-6 on Mondays and Fridays. Check the Student Technology Help Desk for updates.

Parents and students will stay in their vehicles and a technician will come to you.



Student Password Issues

Students need to contact their classroom teacher for password assistance. If the password must be reset, the student's device will need to connect to our district network before they will be able to log in. The campus does not need to be open in order for the device to see the Pasadena ISD network.

Staff Technology Assistance

Please contact the Help Desk at 713-740-0260  if you need assistance with log in issues or access to resources. For additional contact information and hours, visit the Help Desk web page.






 

 Home Internet Opportunities

    
Technology Resources

    https://www1.pasadenaisd.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=80772&pageId=37031141

    


Staff Technology Guides & Information

    
https://pasadenaisdorg.sharepoint.com/sites/TechnologyInstructions










 ","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl26_divTabs_6","title":"Student Services: Enrollment for current 2019-20 school year, Transcripts and more","content":"
ENROLLMENTS (new to Pasadena ISD) & WITHDRAWLS
Due to the COVID-19 school closures, the PISD enrollment and withdrawal process has changed.




ENROLLMENT for CURRENT 2019-2020 SCHOOL YEAR - for Students New to Pasadena ISD

If you are new to Pasadena ISD,  and need to enroll your child, please call 713-740-0000 from 10:00 a.m. – 2:00 p.m., Monday – Friday to schedule an enrollment appointment.  Appointments will be scheduled on a first-come, first-served basis.




Be prepared to provide a good contact phone number and email address. 



WITHDRAWALS


If you need to withdraw your child, please call 713-740-0000 from 10:00 a.m. – 2:00 p.m., 

Monday – Friday.




You must be listed as Family #1 or Family #2 in Skyward to withdraw your child.




You will be required to provide:

    
A photo ID

    
    
Student’s First and Last Legal Name

    
    
Student’s Date of Birth

    
    
Student’s Campus

    
    
The name of the district and school that your child will be attending.

    
    
A good contact phone number and email address




If your child has a PISD technology device, you will be required to turn it in to the Orozco Professional Development Complex located at 1832 East Sam Houston Pkwy S, Pasadena, TX  77503





 

TRANSCRIPT REQUESTS

During the Pasadena ISD closure due to COVID-19, the $1 fee charged for transcripts has been waived.  Transcript requests can be submitted via:

    
Email to Transcripts@PasadenaISD.org 

    
    
Fax to 713-740-4038 or

    
    
US Mail (Mailing address is located on Page 2 of the Transcript Request)



IMPORTANT!  Official Transcripts - Pasadena ISD is required to submit official transcripts directly to the recipient (college, employer, scholarship program, etc.).  

Official Transcripts cannot be sent directly to the requesting student.  

PHOTO IDENTIFICATION REQUIRED for all Non-Official Transcripts that are to be mailed directly to the requesting student. 



> DOWNLOAD TRANSCRIPT REQUEST FORM








Pasadena ISD is currently accepting limited open enrollment/out-of-district transfer applications for the 2020-2021 school year.

***If your child is currently attending PISD on a limited open enrollment/out-of-district transfer, a renewal letter will be mailed to your home address.***



Thank you for your interest in enrolling your child in Pasadena ISD through the Limited Open Enrollment program.   A district panel reviews all applications. If attendance, grades, discipline, and Special Program availability meet the guidelines established by Pasadena ISD, the application is forwarded to the requested campus.  The campus principal makes the final decision on transfer applications.



Along with your completed application, you must submit your child’s 2019-20 school records (August 2019 – Present).  Only complete applications, which include all required documents, will be processed.    



Required documents include:



1.	Completed Transfer Application

2.	Report Card/Grade Report

3.	Attendance Report

4.	Discipline Report 

If your child had no discipline issues, please ask their school to give you something in writing, on school letterhead, that states no discipline issues.

5.	Most recent ARD document (Only applicable if student receives Special Education Services)

6.	If applying under the grandparent clause, both the parent and grandparent must provide two proofs of residence with the application.  The grandparent’s address determines the school the student is eligible to attend.  THE PARENT MUST ENROLL THE CHILD. 

 

> DOWNLOAD TRANSFER APPLICATION



While Pasadena ISD is closed due to COVID-19, applications and required documentation can be submitted via:



Email to Transfers@PasadenaISD.org 



USPS to         Pasadena ISD

Student Services

1515 Cherrybrook Ln

Pasadena, TX  77502

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl26_divTabs_7","title":"Free Food Distributions & Curbside Meals Schedule","content":"
>Curbside Grab and Go Meals - Updated Procedures for the week of April 13

We are excited to announce we received approval to serve curbside grab-and-go meals on Monday, April 13th; therefore, we will serve meals every school day next week.



The following procedures will be implemented in accordance with State Agency guidance:

- Each child in the car will receive a breakfast and lunch daily

- If a child is NOT in the car, then a parent must provide 1 of the following documents:

    
Official letter/email/electronic school document showing the student enrolled
    
Individual student report card
    
Attendance record from parent portal printed or electronic, that includes the children's names
    
Birth Certificates for children not in school
    
Student ID cards


- Meal distribution times will be 9:00 a.m. – 10:30 a.m. and 11:30 a.m. – 1:00 p.m. while supplies last.





>Follow this link for locations and times

Declaración Oficial acerca del programa de desayunos & almuerzos gratis Grab-and-Go



Estamos sumamente emocionados de compartir que hemos recibido aprobación para servir comidas en nuestro programa de autoservicio, “Grab-and-Go” el lunes 13 de abril. Esto significa que estaremos sirviendo comidas todos los días escolares durante la semana que viene.



Los siguientes procedimientos serán implementados acorde con los lineamientos de la Agencia Estatal:



Cada niño(a) recibirá un desayuno y un almuerzo diariamente

Si un niño(a) no se encuentra en el auto, el padre deberá proveer 1 de los siguientes documentos:

Carta/Correo/Documento Electrónico oficial de la escuela que demuestre que el estudiante está inscrito

Boleta de calificaciones individual

Registro de asistencia impreso o digital proveniente del portal para padres de familia que incluye el nombre del niño(a)

Acta de nacimiento del niño(a) si no está inscrito en la escuela

Tarjeta de identificación de estudiante (School ID)

El horario de distribución será de 9:00 a.m. – 10:30 a.m. y de 11:30 a.m. – 1:00 p.m. o hasta agotar suministros.






The Pasadena Chamber of Commerce is maintaining an updated list of city wide food distribution locations with dates and times.  Please visit this link for updated info.



https://www.pasadenachamber.org/food-pantry



La Cámara de Comercio de Pasadena mantiene una lista actualizada de ubicaciones de distribución de alimentos en toda la ciudad con fechas y horas. Visite este enlace para obtener información actualizada.



https://www.pasadenachamber.org/food-pantry

    

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl26_divTabs_8","title":"Public Health Info","content":"

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) website at https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/communication/index.html

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/index.html

    

    
    
World Health Organization: 

    https://www.who.int/health-topics/coronavirus

div.script:
$(document).ready(function () {
        var logConsole = function (str) {
            console.log(str);
        };
        if ($('#tabPortlet_521335 .divTabEdit').val() == "True") {
            var isModern = ('True');
            if(isModern.toLowerCase() == "true")
            {
                var tabObj = $('#tabPortlet_521335 ');
                var tabM = $('#ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl39_divTabs').attr('portlet') == 'tab';

                function activate() {
                    $(tabObj).scrollingTabs({                 
                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl39_divTabs_0","title":"Census 2020","content":"
Counting Everyone\n
The census is here, and we need every household to participate. It will only take a few minutes of your time. You can participate online at www.my2020census.gov, by phone at 1-844-330-2020 or by mail. A paper questionnaire may already be in your mailbox. Our community’s participation is not where it should be. Pasadena ISD is way behind the national and state average at 41.7 percent. 
\n
\nWe are counting on you to help shape our future! Please do it today!
\n
\nSpanish Version: 
\nEl censo ya está aquí y necesitamos que cada vivienda participe. Solo tomará unos minutos. Puedes responder en línea en www.my2020census.gov, por teléfono al 1-844-468-2020 o por correo. Es posible que un cuestionario impreso ya este en tu buzón de correo. La participación de nuestra comunidad actualmente es baja. PasadenaISD se encuentra muy por debajo del promedio estatal y nacional a 41.7 porciento. ¡Estamos contando en ti en asegurar nuestro futuro! ¡Por favor, hazlo hoy mismo!
\n
\n\n\n
Participating in the census is required by law, even if you recently completed another survey from the Census Bureau. A complete and accurate count is critical for you and your community, because the results of the 2020 Census will affect community funding, congressional representation, and more.
\n
\nFor more information please visit
\nEnglish link: www.2020Census.Gov   |   Enlace Español: www.2020census.gov/es
\n
\n","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl39_divTabs_1","title":"See Something - Say Something","content":"\n

\nYour safety and the safety of others is everyone's responsibility. So if you hear something, see something, know something - SAY SOMETHING!
\n
\nShare your concern with a trusted adult by submitting an 
\nanonymous tip to school and district officials.  
\n
\n","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl39_divTabs_2","title":"Graduation 2020","content":"

\n

April is Library Appreciation Month and Pasadena ISD is proud to highlight the work of librarians throughout our district. PISD librarians have been an invaluable resource for our students during the coronavirus pandemic.

br.span: It’s not goodbye when students graduate from Pasadena ISD. Once they start here, they continue to be a lifelong member of their alma mater and school district. Many graduates continue to make this city their home, raising families and contributing to the preservation of the school district and its community. The legacy you have left behind serves as inspiration for this generation and beyond. No matter what school you attended, you are forever part of the fabric that is Pasadena ISD.

a.title: Learn more about our Alumni program

br.a: Visit Alumni Central for more info!

br.br:
The Pasadena ISD Education Foundation has been created to support educational programs for both the students and staff of the district. The foundation provides funds for educational programs and activities which either have not been funded or have been under-funded by the normal operating budget.
Distributed to teachers who apply in the form of mini-grants, the funds are used to facilitate innovative teaching strategies, energize student achievement and skill development, recognize and encourage staff excellence and expand community involvement from individuals, businesses and civic organizations.
See how the Education Foundation and Mini-Grants benefit the students of Pasadena ISD

br.span: The Pasadena Independent School District is an equal opportunity employer and provides equal access for all students.
